title: NYPD Officer Shot Three Times in Brooklyn, Later Released From Hospital
sub_head: The shooting marks the seventh time a New York City officer has been shot in the past six months
body:
A New York Police Department officer was shot while searching for a suspect in a fatal shooting in Brooklyn on Wednesday night, marking the seventh time in the past six months that a New York City officer was struck by gunfire, police officials said.
The officer, Brian McGurran, was shot by a man that he and other officers tried to stop blocks away from the earlier shooting, the officials said. Officer McGurran was hit in the leg, buttocks and chest, where he was protected by a bulletproof vest, the officials said. He was treated and released from a hospital on Thursday, according to the officials.
Mr. McGurran, 28 years old, is a four-year veteran of the NYPD assigned to the 81st Precinct in Brooklyn, according to police officials.
The shooting, which occurred in the Bedford-Stuyvesant section of the borough, follows a surge in gun violence in the city since the start of the Covid-19 pandemic. There have been 451 shootings this year through May 9, up 85% from 242 during the same period in 2020.
Wednesdayâ€™s incident began when Officer McGurran and other officers patrolling the neighborhood in an unmarked car were alerted to reports of a gunman firing into a white SUV on a busy commercial strip at 11:11 p.m., NYPD Commissioner Dermot Shea said early Thursday.
